title: The Inflation Tax Bites Workers
sub_head: Private pay and benefits are booming, but they can’t keep up with prices.
body:
The headlines Friday said that worker compensation grew at a record pace in this year’s first quarter, according to the Labor Department. That would be nice—if it weren’t for the inflation that is wiping out those hefty nominal gains.
Wages and salaries rose 5% for private workers in the 12 months through March, and benefits rose 4.1%. Private employers are paying a lot more to keep workers, who have bargaining power amid a labor shortage.
